title: Tribeca adds analysts for equities
text:
Equities house Tribeca Investment Partners has recruited a pair of analysts to work for Jun Bei Liu's long/short strategy.

It is understood Tribeca has picked up Angus Wright who was formerly Charlie Aitken's right hand man at Aitken Investment Management and a portfolio manager for Aitken's global long'short equity fund.

Jun Bei Liu took over sole portfolio management responsibilities at Tribeca's Alpha Plus Fund earlier this year. Janie Barrett

Tribeca has also hired Tom Cutler, who joins out of Credit Suisse's investment banking team and previously worked in the Swiss bank's equities research unit.

The two men are expected to report to Tribeca founder David Aylward and Liu, who runs Tribeca's well-known Alpha Plus Fund.

The hires come after a busy few months for Liu, who took over sole portfolio management responsibilities earlier this year following the departure of Sean Fenton.

It also comes soon after Liu's fund is understood to have received a cheque from one of the country's largest institutional investors, UniSuper.

Tribeca recently told investors its Alpha Plus Fund outperformed the index by nearly 4 per cent in the September quarter, with positive contributions from the likes of James Hardie and Afterpay Touch.
description: Tribeca Investment Partners has recruited a pair of analysts to work for Jun Bei Liu's long/short strategy.
